Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.annotations

Annotation Interface Related

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(METHOD) public @interface Related
Used to declare methods which defines a link relation and the expected type for linked or embedded resources. For each link relation there must be only one corresponding Related method in your HalApiInterface.

The return value of the methods must provide one ore more instances of another HalApiInterface type. These can either be returned directly, or wrapped in an Optional, Stream, List, or one of the supported reactive types (e.g. Single, Maybe, Observable).

You can also represent links to other non-HAL resources (e.g. HTML, text or binary) by using Link as return type. Again this can be wrapped as appropriate (e.g. a Stream of Links for multiple external links.

Methods with this annotation can have parameters with TemplateVariable or TemplateVariables annotations to define URI templates that clients can expand with the values specified in those parameters.

If any of these parameters are invoked with null values, the link template will be only partially expanded and you can access the partially expanded template by calling LinkableResource.createLink() on the returned proxies. The proxy will still fully resolve the link template (by stripping variables with null values) before fetching the resource (if you call any other method on the proxy that requires the resource to be loaded)

On the server side, these methods will be called by the framework when the resource is rendered. Any parameters for template parameters will be invoked with a null value.

See Also:
  • TemplateVariables
  • TemplateVariable

    • value

      String value
      Defines the relation of the linked or embedded resource to this context resource.
      Returns:
      a standard relation or CURI of a custom relation (i.e. "prefix:relation")
